prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: During the channeling, the defendant saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Of course, the victim used the last of his strength to fight back, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: While the two were fighting, the victim took out his gun.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: The defendant then picked up on the opening and took the victim's gun, and ended it...
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, the task is to look through the given testimonies and evidences and find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies provided by Detective Gumshoe. There are four testimonies here. Testimony 0 says that during the channeling, Maya stabbed the victim in the chest. Then Testimony 1 claims the victim used his last strength to fight back. Testimony 2 states the victim took out his gun during the fight. Testimony 3 mentions the victim took a shot but missed because they were too close. Finally, Testimony 4 says the defendant (Maya) took the gun and ended it.

Now, looking at the evidences. Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report (Evidence 8) says he was stabbed in the chest first and then shot in the forehead at point-blank. There's gunpowder residue around the bullet hole, which indicates the shot was very close. The Pistol (Evidence 9) is the murder weapon, with two shots fired, and has both Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. The Knife (Evidence 10) is the other weapon, a fruit knife with Maya's prints.

Gumshoe's testimonies suggest a sequence where Grey was stabbed, then fought back, pulled out a gun, missed a shot, and then Maya took the gun and shot him. But according to the Autopsy Report, the victim was stabbed first and then shot in the forehead. However, the key point here is Testimony 3 where Gumshoe says the victim took a shot but missed because they were too close. But the autopsy report mentions that the gunshot was at point-blank range (so very close) and the bullet hit the forehead. If the shot was point-blank, then it's impossible that he missed. So Testimony 3 claims the victim missed, but the evidence (Autopsy Report) shows he was shot in the forehead, meaning the shot actually hit. That's a contradiction.

Wait, but wait, Testimony 3 says the victim took a shot and missed. But the actual cause of death is a gunshot to the forehead. So if the victim fired a shot that missed, but the fatal shot was fired by Maya (as per Testimony 4), then maybe the autopsy report's gunshot is the one from Maya. However, the Autopsy Report says he was first stabbed, then shot. So perhaps the victim fired a shot (which missed), and then Maya took the gun and shot him again. But the autopsy report indicates only one gunshot (since it's mentioned as being shot in the forehead). Wait, the Pistol (Evidence 9) says two shots were fired. So maybe the first shot was from the victim (which missed), and the second shot was from Maya (which hit). But the autopsy report says the cause of death is the gunshot. So the contradiction would be that Testimony 3 says the victim missed his shot, but the actual cause of death is a gunshot, implying that Maya's shot hit. But the Autopsy Report says he was shot at point-blank, which would be Maya's shot. So maybe there's no contradiction there. Hmm.

Wait, let me check the Autopsy Report again. It states that after being stabbed, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. The gunpowder residue around the bullet hole suggests the shot was very close. Now, according to the testimony sequence: Grey is stabbed, fights back, takes out the gun, fires but misses (Testimony 3), then Maya takes the gun and shoots him (Testimony 4). So the victim's shot would have been the first shot (which missed), and Maya's shot would be the second, which hit. The Pistol (Evidence 9) has two shots fired. But the Autopsy Report says he was shot once, in the forehead. So maybe the two shots are the one that missed and the one that hit. But how does that line up with the Autopsy Report? The autopsy report says he was shot once. Wait, no—the Autopsy Report says "stabbed in the chest then shot at point-blank." So the shot is the fatal one. The gun had two shots fired. So one shot from Grey (missed) and one from Maya (hit). So the shot that hit was from Maya, which would be the second shot. The autopsy report's gunshot is the one that killed him. So the contradiction would be that Testimony 3 says the victim's shot missed, but if the victim's shot was the first one, which missed, then the second shot (Maya's) is the one that hit. That would align with the autopsy report. So perhaps no contradiction here.

Wait, but the Autopsy Report says "shot in the forehead at point-blank." The gunpowder residue indicates the shot was very close. If the victim was fighting back and then Maya took the gun and shot him, that would be point-blank. So maybe the testimony and evidence here don't contradict. Hmm.

Wait, maybe another angle. Let's look at the Folding Screen (Evidence 4) which has a bullet hole 8 inches off the ground. If there was a bullet hole in the screen, that could be from the missed shot. The Pistol has two shots fired. So if the first shot from Grey missed and hit the screen (hole 8 inches off the ground), and the second shot from Maya hit Grey in the forehead, that would make sense. But the Autopsy Report says he was shot in the forehead. So maybe the testimonies and evidence line up here. Wait, but in Testimony 3, Gumshoe says that the victim took a shot but missed because they were too close. If they were too close, how could the shot miss? If they were too close, the shot would be more likely to hit, unless perhaps the gun was fired from too close and the angle was off. But according to the autopsy, the shot was point-blank. So maybe the contradiction is that Testimony 3 claims the victim missed due to being too close, but the actual gunshot that killed him was at point-blank, meaning the shot that hit was from very close. Wait, but the missed shot would be the first one (from Grey), and the second shot (from Maya) was the point-blank one. So Testimony 3 refers to Grey's shot, which missed and hit the screen (Evidence 4). Then Maya's shot hit him. So that would align. Therefore, perhaps the contradiction is not there.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 0 says Maya stabbed Grey during the channeling. But the Sacred Urn (Evidence 14) was broken by Pearl right before the murder, and under repair in the hallway. If the channeling requires the Sacred Urn, and it was broken, maybe the channeling couldn't happen. But I'm not sure if that's a direct contradiction. Also, the channeling chamber might still be used even if the urn is under repair. So maybe not.

Looking at Maya's Costume (Evidence 11): blood splatters and a bullet hole in the sleeve. If the victim fired a shot that missed (Testimony 3), perhaps that shot went through Maya's sleeve, creating the bullet hole. But according to Testimony 3, the shot missed Grey, but the bullet hole in the screen (Evidence 4) would be from that shot. Wait, but the costume's bullet hole is in the sleeve. So if the shot went through her sleeve and then into the screen, that would explain both. But perhaps the bullet hole in the screen is 8 inches off the ground, which might be lower than the height of Maya's sleeve. But without specific height details, it's hard to say. Alternatively, the Clothing Box (Evidence 17) also has a bullet hole 8 inches off the ground, which could be the same as the Folding Screen. Maybe multiple bullet holes. But the Pistol had two shots fired. So if two shots were fired, one hit Grey (forehead), one hit the screen or clothing box. But then the Autopsy Report says he was shot once. So perhaps one shot from the gun was fired by Maya (hit), and the other shot was earlier. Wait, the gun had two shots fired. So maybe two shots in total. If Grey fired once (missed, hitting the screen), and Maya fired once (hit). Then the two shots would be accounted for. That would fit. But the Autopsy Report only mentions one gunshot wound. So that's consistent. Therefore, no contradiction there.

Wait, the Autopsy Report says he was stabbed and then shot. So only one gunshot. But the gun had two shots fired. That suggests that two bullets were fired from the gun. One missed (hit the screen), one hit Grey. But the autopsy report only notes the fatal shot. So that's possible. So no contradiction here.

Hmm. Let's think again. The key contradiction must be between a testimony and an evidence. Let's check Testimony 3 again. It says the victim took a shot but missed because they were too close. If the shot was too close, the gunpowder residue would be present. The Autopsy Report mentions gunpowder residue around the bullet hole, which is from the shot that killed him (Maya's shot). The victim's shot (Testimony 3) missed. So the missed shot would not have gunpowder residue on Grey, but the hit shot (from Maya) would. That makes sense. So where's the contradiction?

Wait, perhaps the Autopsy Report indicates that the shot was at point-blank, which means the shooter was very close. Testimony 3 says that when the victim fired, they were too close, causing him to miss. But if they were too close, how could he miss? Maybe the contradiction is that if the victim fired at point-blank, he couldn't have missed. But according to the testimony, he did miss. But the actual shot that hit was from Maya, which was at point-blank. So the victim's shot missed (possibly hitting the screen), and Maya's shot hit. So the contradiction isn't there. 

Wait, maybe the folding screen's bullet hole is 8 inches off the ground. If the victim was standing and fired a shot, the bullet hole would be higher. But 8 inches is very low, maybe suggesting the shooter was on the ground. But if the victim was stabbed and then fighting back, maybe he was on the ground when he fired, leading to a low bullet hole. But that's speculative. 

Another angle: The Knife (Evidence 10) has Maya's fingerprints. Testimony 0 says Maya stabbed him. That's consistent. The blood on Maya's costume (Evidence 11) would be from the stabbing. The bullet hole in her sleeve would be from the victim's missed shot. So that aligns with Testimony 3. 

Wait, the Autopsy Report says the victim was stabbed first, then shot. The testimonies follow that order. So Testimony 0: stabbing. Then Testimony 2: victim takes gun. Testimony 3: victim fires and misses. Testimony 4: Maya takes the gun and shoots. That sequence matches the autopsy. So no contradiction there.

Wait, what about the fact that the Autopsy Report says he was shot in the forehead at point-blank, but Testimony 4 says Maya took the gun and ended it. If Maya shot him at point-blank, that would explain the residue. So that's consistent.

Hmm. Maybe another angle. Let's look at the Pistol (Evidence 9) which has Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. Testimony 4 says Maya took the gun from Grey and shot him, so her fingerprints would be on it. Grey's would be from when he handled it. That's consistent. 

Looking at the other evidence: Newspaper Clipping 2 (Evidence 6) talks about the car accident involving Ini and Mimi. But perhaps not directly relevant to the testimonies here.

Wait, let me check Testimony 3 again: "The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed." If the victim (Grey) was too close to Maya when he fired, and missed, but the bullet hole in the folding screen (Evidence 4) is 8 inches off the ground, maybe that's where the missed shot went. But if the shot was fired from close range and missed, the bullet hole would be in the screen. But the folding screen's bullet hole is part of the evidence, so that aligns. So no contradiction here.

Wait, but the Autopsy Report says he was shot at point-blank. That refers to the shot that killed him, fired by Maya. So Testimony 3 refers to Grey's shot, which missed. Then Testimony 4 refers to Maya's shot, which hit. The Autopsy Report's gunpowder residue is from Maya's shot. So everything aligns. 

Maybe I'm missing something else. Let's look at the other evidences. The Sacred Urn (14) was broken before the murder. If the channeling was happening, maybe the urn being broken affects that. But Testimony 0 says during the channeling, Maya stabbed him. If the urn was broken, perhaps channeling wasn't possible. But the game's lore might allow channeling even if the urn is broken, or maybe it was a fake channeling. That's a possible contradiction, but maybe not directly linked to the testimonies given.

Alternatively, look at Lotta's Photos (12 and 13). The first photo shows Maya at the scene with Grey dead behind her. The second photo also. If the testimonies say that Maya took the gun and shot him, then the photos would show the body with a gunshot wound, which they do. So that's consistent.

Another angle: The Knife (10) is a fruit knife from the Fey's. Maya's fingerprints are on it. Testimony 0 says she used it. That's consistent. The blood on her costume (11) also aligns. 

Wait, the Clothing Box (17) also has a bullet hole 8 inches off the ground. If there are two bullet holes (folding screen and clothing box), but the gun only fired two shots, one from Grey (missed, hit screen) and one from Maya (hit Grey), but then the Clothing Box bullet hole would be unexplained. Unless the two shots hit two different places. But the Pistol (9) says two shots were fired. So maybe two bullet holes: screen and clothing box. That would align. But the Autopsy Report only mentions one shot on Grey. So that's okay. 

Hmm. I'm struggling to find a clear contradiction here. Let me try another approach. The key is to find a testimony that directly conflicts with a piece of evidence.

Looking at Testimony 3 again: The victim's shot missed because they were too close. But if the shot was fired at point-blank, as per the autopsy report (for the fatal shot), that's a different shot. The victim's shot missed, and the fatal shot was from Maya. The autopsy report's mention of gunpowder residue is about the fatal shot, which was point-blank. So no contradiction there. 

Wait, but the Pistol (Evidence 9) says two shots were fired. If Grey's shot was one, and Maya's was the second, then two shots total. But the bullet hole in the screen and the fatal shot would account for both. So the folding screen's hole is from the missed shot, and the fatal shot is the other. So that's okay. 

Maybe the contradiction is elsewhere. Let's check Testimony 0: During the channeling, Maya stabbed him. But the channeling chamber's floor plan (7) is a four-sectioned mat in front of a platform. If the channeling was in progress, maybe the position of the body or the scenario doesn't align. But without more info, hard to say.

Alternatively, look at the fact that the victim was stabbed first, then shot. Testimony 0 says Maya stabbed him during the channeling. Then the fight happened where he took out the gun. But the autopsy report says he was stabbed then shot, which matches the testimonies. 

Wait, the Knife (10) is a small fruit knife. If the stab wound was in the chest, maybe the knife's size is an issue. But the autopsy report just says stabbed in the chest; it doesn't specify the depth or weapon size. So not necessarily a contradiction. 

Hmm. Maybe the key contradiction is between Testimony 3 (victim's shot missed) and the Folding Screen's bullet hole (Evidence 4). If the shot missed and hit the screen, which is 8 inches off the ground, but the victim was standing, then a bullet hole that low would suggest the shooter was on the ground. If Grey was stabbed and then on the ground when he fired, that could explain it. But if he was standing, the bullet hole should be higher. So maybe the contradiction is that Testimony 3 says the victim fired while they were close (implying they were both standing), but the bullet hole is very low, suggesting the shot was fired from a lower position, like someone on the ground. 

If Grey was stabbed and then fell to the ground, then fired the gun, creating a low bullet hole, that would align. But Testimony 3 says they were too close, causing the miss. If he was on the ground, the proximity might not be the reason for missing. But this is speculative. 

Alternatively, the bullet hole in the folding screen (Evidence 4) is at 8 inches, which is very low. If the victim fired while standing, the bullet hole should be higher. Therefore, the shot couldn't have been fired by someone standing, implying that the shooter was on the ground. But Testimony 3 says the victim fired the shot. So if the victim was on the ground when he fired, that would explain the low bullet hole. But the testimonies say that after being stabbed, he fought back, took out the gun, etc. So if he was on the ground, Testimony 2 and 3 would have to reflect that. But the testimonies don't mention him being on the ground. So perhaps the contradiction is between the height of the bullet hole and the testimony's implication that the victim was standing when he fired.

Therefore, the evidence (Folding Screen's bullet hole at 8 inches) contradicts Testimony 3, which describes the victim firing while standing and missing because they were too close. The low bullet hole suggests the shot was fired from a lower position, possibly when the victim was already on the ground, which contradicts the testimony's scenario of a close-range struggle where the victim misses due to proximity.

So the correct pair would be Evidence 4 (Folding Screen with bullet hole 8 inches) and Testimony 3 (victim's missed shot due to proximity), as the low bullet hole suggests the shot was fired from a prone position, not from a close struggle where proximity caused a miss.

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}
